intro: Trixis ochroleuca f. subintegra, commonly known as the white-flowered trixis, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in umbels. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, preferring well-drained soils. It is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats, thriving in full sun. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in suitable climates.
